p:
After 7 days of incubation at 28 °C in the dark, the colony growth diameter (mm) was measured using a 150-mm digital caliper. The growth inhibition was calculated using the formula
41 :
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\rm{Mycelial}}\,{\rm{growth}}\,{\rm{inhibition}}=[({\rm{DC}}-{\rm{DT}})/{\rm{DC}}]\times 100$$\end{document}
Mycelial
growth
inhibition = [ ( DC − DT ) / DC ] × 100
